channel.title: PI "Smith All" option
channel.description:
How do I add smith all option so my players don't have to keep clicking bar.
Will ++Rep for correct answer! ;)

item.title: PI "Smith All" option
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:5, topic:411935”][quote author=Kalvin link=topic=513193.msg3725756#msg3725756 date=1314247482]

for (int smithAll =  1; smithAll != 28; smithAll++) {
//code you want to repeat
}[/code]

That will work, it.

Here's an example

		[code=java]
if(playerCommand.startsWith("loop")){
for (int smithAll =  1; smithAll != 5; smithAll++) {
c.sendMessage("test");
}
}

This means, if i type “loop” it will keep on executing the sendmessage 5 times. And when its equal to 5 it will stop. That should be enough to help you w.o spoon feeding you it.
[/quote]

I don’t get it? :L[/quote]

Basically, you have to find your smithing method such as when a player uses the item on the object, then u add the loop to it. So post the code which allows the player to use an item on the object and cook one. I’ll try to add it for you

Read full topic

item.title: PI "Smith All" option
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“Kalvin, post:2, topic:411935”] for (int smithAll = 1; smithAll != 28; smithAll++) { //code you want to repeat }

That will work, it.

Here’s an example

	[code=java]

if(playerCommand.startsWith(“loop”)){
for (int smithAll = 1; smithAll != 5; smithAll++) {
c.sendMessage(“test”);
}
}
[/code]

This means, if i type “loop” it will keep on executing the sendmessage 5 times. And when its equal to 5 it will stop. That should be enough to help you w.o spoon feeding you it.[/quote]

I don’t get it? :L

Read full topic

item.title: PI "Smith All" option
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Doesn’t 317/377 have an ‘X’ option? Players can just do “Smith X”, type in 28, and you’re done. Otherwise, I believe there are some client-side interface changes that need to be made.

Read full topic

item.title: PI "Smith All" option
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

for (int smithAll =  1; smithAll != 28; smithAll++) {
//code you want to repeat
}[/code]

That will work, it.

Here's an example

		[code=java]
if(playerCommand.startsWith("loop")){
for (int smithAll =  1; smithAll != 5; smithAll++) {
c.sendMessage("test");
}
}

This means, if i type “loop” it will keep on executing the sendmessage 5 times. And when its equal to 5 it will stop. That should be enough to help you w.o spoon feeding you it.

Read full topic
